alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 26 at 5:23PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...Anchorage * WHEN...Until noon AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas due to rain and snowmelt. Additionally, rain falling on frozen or snowpacked roads may lead to slick driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM AKST, Trained weather spotters reported rain and snowmelt causing ponding on roadways with minor flooding along Minnesota Dr. Additional rain and snowmelt combined with poor drainage conditions are expected through tonight and Monday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments on weather.gov/Anchorage or by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
